CRP is one of the largest private-lands conservation programs in the United States, paying producers an annual rental rate in exchange for undertaking soil, water, and wildlife habitat improvements on erodible, environmentally sensitive land.

CSP is the largest working lands conservation program in the United States, providing agricultural and non-industrial private forestland operators opportunities to recognize excellent stewards and deliver valuable new conservation.
EQIP provides financial and technical assistance to agricultural producers to address natural resource concerns and deliver environmental benefits.
Popular conservation programs include the Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP), Conservation Stewardship Program (CSP), and Conservation Reserve Program (CRP).

‚ÄúLatinx‚Äù and ‚ÄúLatine‚Äù can be used interchangeably.

The preference comes from Latinos who acknowledge that the letter ‚ÄúX‚Äù is not very present in Spanish, so some Queer people opt to use ‚ÄúLatine‚Äù instead.

#MD04, if you‚Äôre Latino/a/x/e, how do you identify? üëÄ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Recently, the righteous fight for person-first, inclusive language for queer Latin people has introduced us to the gender-neutral terms:
